alert.note: Alert for Central Panhandle Mountains (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 08 at 10:56PM MST until December 10 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 8 to 14 inches at Lookout Pass with 4 to 8 inches possible in the Silver Valley and around St. Maries. The heaviest snow is expected to fall between Saturday evening through early Sunday morning. * WHERE...Lookout Pass, Kellogg, Wallace, Pinehurst, Fourth Of July Pass, Mullan, Osburn, St. Maries, Dobson Pass, and Fernwood. * WHEN...From Saturday afternoon through Sunday evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Plan on slippery road conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...70% chance for snowfall rates of one half to one inch per hour Saturday night through Sunday morning.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
